review_blob: Malt, rasins, coffee and bitter chocolate nose that pours out pitch black with a large brown/tan head and oily lacing.  Very creamy and rich mouth feel thats full of chocolate, toffee and slight bitter dry finish.  A very nice sweet stout, especially for the price at Trader Joes in Riverside CA. ($ 5.99/6 pack).
Nice bold piney hop aroma.  Pours out golden brown with nice tan head with mild lacing.  Nice hop bite with citrus trailings that end with a flavorful bitter finish.  Very nice beer.

beer_brewer_name: Yakima Brewing And Malting Co./Bert Grants Real Ales
review_blob: Malt nose with pine and citrus trailings.  Deep amber color with small tan head.  Flavor was mildly bitter with strong fruit tones.  Thick mouth feel with mild alcohol bite.  Not a bad IPA, just not great.

I purchased this beer back in May and kept it in the fridge.  I purchased it a more of a novelty, thinking that a beer with 20% alcohol would be a little too strong, but I was very, very wrong.  Aroma was fruity with hints on apricots and sweet malt.  Poured out clean clear dark amber with a very small head.  Flavor was rich and complex and slightly sweet.  Full rich mouth feel and great robust flavors of hops, malt, and fruit.  I must say this is the very best IPA I have ever had.  The alcohol was well hidden and didnt over power.  I just wish I had more!

Malty, barley, somewhat musty aroma.  Deep, almost black color with a good tan head and good lacing.  Flavor mildly complex, with hints of chocolate, coffee and malt.  Palate is where this brew really falls short, very thin with a light dry finish.  Not bad but I like the Oatmeal Breakfast Stout from HopTown better.

Deep dark, almost black color and medium tan head.  Flavor was creamy and rich, hummy!  Very full mouth feel and complex chocolate flavor that I really enjoyed.  Initially smooth but with a strong bitte after taste that seems to last too long.  Overall it is, in my opinion, a better brew than the rating indicates.

Musty, damp malt, slightly pungnet aroma that pours out dark brown/orange.  Small head with strong oily lacing.  Flavor is complex, maybe too complex.  I dont know if I am just not used to this brew style or I just dont like this beer.  Certainly not the best offering from Moylans.

Aroma is fruity with hits on malt and hops.  Amber/orange cloudy color with good lacing and medium tan head.  Flavor is good but has somewhat of an odd aftertaste.  Not a bad IPA just nothing special.

Very nice foral and citrus and mango aroma that pours out  clear amber.  Large white head with loads of lacing that really lasts.  Very smooth with distinct hop and malt flavor that hints of honey.  Medium mouthfeel and mild hop bite aftertaste.  I really enjoyed this IPA.  I personally think it should be rated higher than the overall average.  If you enjoy hops and a clean easy drinking smooth brew this one just might be the ticket.

Mild malt and candy aroma that pours out dark deep red with a lot of tan micro bubbles and strong lacing.  Flavor was surprisingly smooth at first, with rich malt, fruit and candy taste that ends very biter.  Extremely easy to drink, if you dont mind the aftertaste, which is bitter and slightly off.

Aroma is malt, fruit, citrus and candy.  Very rich and flavorful with mild hints of hops and toffee.  Very tasty and quite smooth for a barley wine.  Outstanding across the palate, and the alcohol is very well hidden.  The only complaint I have for this one is the price.  At .42 per ounce it's quite expensive considering you can get Big Foot for .13 per ounce, or Old Victory at .19, it may not be worth the price.  Also what's up with the 7 oz bottles?  Seems like a marketing scheme to make more money, anyway it really is a great barley wine.

Pours out black, just like the bottle indicated.  Aroma was malty with hints of sourdough bread.  Large tan head with noticeable lacing.  Flavor was malt, almonds and hints of toffee.  Somewhat thin on the palette with a medium dry finish.  The bottle didnt indicate what style of beer this was so I wasnt sure what to expect.  Overall I would classify this one as a porter.  Sampled on 2/21/04 at Rodo Viva in Temecula, CA.

sampled 2/9/04.  Thanks Hi-Time Wine Cellars in Costa Mesa.

*** 2001 ***
Beautifual floral aroma with mild hints of apricots and citrus.  Flavor was complex and full.  Initally the favor is malt that changes to mild apricot and citrus with a very suprising hop bite.  Extreamly full and rich mouth feel that is very pleasing.  This needs a higher rating everyone!  Outstanding!

*** 2002 ***
Aroma was simular to the 2001 but much less complex and more mild.  Flavor was very good but somewhat unbalanced.

Strong malt aroma with hints of coffee and bakers chocolate.  Very dark color with medium head and lacing.  Flavor was somewhat unbalanced, and weak but not offensive.  Malt, bitter chocolate and a slight hop bite with a dry finish.  Somewhat thin mouth feel and slight bitter aftertaste.  Not a bad stout, just nothing setting it apart.

Mild pine/hop aroma with light color and carbonation.  Flavor is very bitter with some nice spicy hop taste and unfortunately turns harshly odd.  Medium mouth feel with a nice dry finish, but that soon fades and a harsh bitter after taste that lingers way too long.  I really didn't get an IPA sense from this brew, more of some IPA/Spice combination that doesn't work.
Aroma is malt with some sour fruit tones.  Flavor is spicy hops and sourdough bread.  Thin across the palate and somewhat unbalanced.  Not something that I would seek out again.
Musty grass smell with some aroma of hops and malt.  First impressions are of bitter and hop goodness that transitions into an unbalanced and eventual harsh flavor.

I was presently surprised by this IPA I must admit.  I had read some of the reviews before I had tried this one and I don't really understand why it rates so low?  Mild grass hop and pine aroma that isn't as strong as I would like but pleasant nonetheless.  Pours out copper orange red with a medium head and noticeable lacing.  Flavor was strong bitter at first than trailing off to a dry finish.  Fairly well balanced and very easy to drink.  A very good session beer.  I think it deserves a higher rating that it gets by most, but that?s just my opinion.  Try it, I don?t think it will disappoint.

Pours out raspberry red, like you would think.  Little to no head with limited lacing.  Aroma was a very fruity, as was the smooth tangy raspberry flavor.  Very much a liquid sorbet with a nice sour finish.  Very nice desert drink.  I would like it better if it actually had a little more alcohol.

Musty malt aroma with very mild hints of hops.  I thought this was supposed to be an IPA?  Pours clear red with little head.  Very average and somewhat boring in character. Flavor was too mild and not very satisfying.  Not what and IPA should be.

Sweet floral wine aroma that pours out clear and golden yellow with almost no head.  Sweet fruity flavor that reminds me of a wine cooler, too sweet almost candy like.  Very thin mouth feel and metallic aftertaste.  I can honestly say this is not my favorite offering from the Stone Brewing Company.

Musky malt and coffee aroma.  Pours black with small tan head and good lacing.  Flavor was mild expresso with mild hints of hops and bitter chocolate mixed in.  Slightly thin accross the palate with a nice dry bitter finish.

Wonderful hop floral aroma that you can smell from accross the room.  Pours copper amber red with a huge, and I mean huge head that lasts for days.  Full complex bitter hop and appricot flavor that is very pleasing.  A suppurb Imperial IPA.

Very floural and piney with some citrus trailing.  Pours copper and clear with strong carbonation and large off white head with good lacing.  Flavor was very pleasing with good hop bite and rich mouth feel.  Very nice Double/Imperial IPA.
beer_name: Marin Eldridge Grade White Knuckle Double IPA

review_blob: Somewhat musty malt aroma that pours dark with small head and little lacing.  Flavor was mildly complex with unexpected sour tartness and thin mouth feel.  No a bad beer but I don't think this is something that I would seek out.

Inital aroma is that of sourdough bread and malt.  Poured dark red/brown with good head and lacing.  Flavor was rich and thick of malt, yeast and some spice.  Very good American Pale Ale.  Finish was somewhat sweet and dry.  Very nice brew.

Citrus and pine aroma   Poured clear orange/red with a medium tan head that lasts.  Flavor was strong citrus and pine with bitter hop trailing.  Full thick mouth feel and nice dry hop bite.  Much better balance than that of the 4th anniversary IPA.

Citrus and mild pine aroma with some hints of grass.  Poured cloudy orange/red with a medium tan head that didn't last.  Flavor was strong citrus and pine with bitter hop trailing.  Full thick mouth feel and nice dry hop bite.

Mildly pine and candy aroma.  Pours cloudy orange red with a nice tan head.  Flavor is somewhat sweet for an IPA with strong hints of spices...maybe ginger?  Very bitter and dry finish.  A nice IPA, but in my opinion not to the level everyone is rating it at.  Especially considering the price!  None the less, a good IPA, but not to the level of Stone.

Very aromatic with glorious hop richness.  Copper red with large tan head and good lacing.  Flavor was smooth and balanced.  This has to be the best barley wine I have ever tried!  Exceptional in every way.

Very fruity, malty, floral and candy aroma.  Small tan head with lacing that could last for days.  Flavor is complex, rich and very satisfying.  Citrus, nuts, dates, malt and hints of glorious hops.  I am actually surprised with the ratings on this barley wine, as I found it to be rather exceptional for its class.  Alcohol is very well hidden and the flavors blend well in balance with good harmony.  If you enjoy barley wine you shouldn't pass this one up, top shelf!

Musty, leathery, malty aroma with trailing of smoke.  Small head with good lacing.  Flavor is complex but somewhat unbalanced.  Toffee, malt and nutty almost chewy flavor that runs the gamete of tastes.  Running bitter espresso, sour black cherries, malt and alcohol with a strong bitter sweet chocolate after taste.  The flavors change with the temperature of the brew, actually getting better once the initial variations and unbalanced flavor settles, but only somewhat.  Rich mouth feel with alcohol warming.  A good Imperial Stout but lacks balance, maybe some aging would assist this brew.

Bitter chocolate and toffee with lingering smoke malt aroma.  Dark, almost black with strong lacing and a good dark brown head.  Flavor was rich with bitter sweet chocolate and coffee with a strong bitter finish.  A very nice porter.

Aroma of plums and dates with a slight hint of malt.  Medium tan head with some noticeable lacing.  Fruit flavor of plums and raisins with the alcohol hidden well.   Somewhat sour across the palate with a slight aftertaste of citrus.

beer_brewer_name: Portland Brewing Company (Pyramid - North American Breweries)
review_blob: I have tried the Blackwatch Cream Porter before, and while I wasn't disappointed, I wasn't overly impressed.  This one is quite different!  The Cask Aged version is very smooth with a hint of bourbon, but not too much.  Very nice coffee/toffee aroma, with a mild hint of raisins.  Black as night with a big cream/tan head and strong lacing.  Rich flavor of caramel, espresso and toffee with a silky cream essence.  Full mouth feel without being oily or syrupy.  While it's quite pricy (6.00 for 22 oz.) This is a very very enjoyable.  A very nice porter.
beer_name: MacTarnahans Bourbon Cask Aged Blackwatch Cream Porter

review_blob: Black Stout indeed!  Musty malt and yeast aroma that poured out black as night with a large coco head with large bubbles.  Flavor was burnt chocolate and coffee with a very bitter after taste.  Palate was very thick and pleasing.
beer_name: Bear Republic Big Bear Black Stout

review_blob: The aroma of this beer is truly great, very floral and hoppy with a mild hint of citrus.  Large head with good lacing and strong carbonation.  Flavor is smooth and well balanced but a little mild for my taste in IPA's.  Slightly bitter after taste, but pleasing to the palate nonetheless.

Musty sweet malt and bread with a hint of nuts, maybe pecans?  Orange amber with golden highlights and a huge head of creamy micro bubbles and strong lacing.  Smooth upfront with noticeable sweet malt and yeast finishing with a very bourbon aftertaste and some noticeable alcohol flavor.  Chewy mouth feel with a range of flavors of toffee, citrus, malt and scotch.  Very enjoyable, but more like a barley wine than and English Strong Ale

beer_brewer_name: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company
review_blob: Batch #50.  Heard a lot about this brewery but never got the opportunity to try one of there brews, until last night.  Wonderful aroma of hops, citrus and apricots and a mild lingering of yeast.  Cloudy golden orange with a huge head that really lasts.  Flavor was very smooth and clean.  Good balance and complexity with flavors ranging from citrus and peach to malt and sourdough bread finishing with a nice hop sting.  Very appealing to the palate with mild hop and citrus sting.  Alcohol was very well hidden, considering the 10% abv.  A great example of what a Barley Wine should be.  Highly recommend this one.
I really can't tell the difference between this one and Molson Canadian.  Somewhat sweet to dry bitter finish.  Very much the Canadian standard here, simple.
Somewhat skunk to mild yeast smell.  Light yellow color with acidic and malt flavor and bitter dry aftertaste.  Not that appealing.

Musty straw aroma with a yellow color and white head.  Flavor is acidic and dry with a mild hint of malt and mildly odd aftertaste.  Thin palate and water mouth feel.  If you listen to all the advertising on this one you would think it is great, well it's not.
Light is definately the right word.  Slight bread aroma and yellow color with medium head and carbonation.  Not really bad, just not much there.
Mild malt and skunk aroma that pours clear with lots of carbonation and medium head.  Not a bad beer just average.

Growing up me and all my friends thought that this was a great beer, now my impressions have changed, along with my taste.  Malt and grass nose with clear thin body and is not offensive just lacks character.
Skunk and grass aroma with small white head and clear yellow color.  Somewhat dry and bitter.
Growing up I drank alot of this beer because it was cheep and I didn't know better.  Lots of carbonation and very little flavor.Not offensive, a simple beer.

Almost no aroma to speak of with very mild bread like sent.  Clear and lots of carbonation with a medium white head.  Flavor is like mild yeast to malt.  Easy to drink, but so is water and this is supposed to be beer.
Grassy and mild skunk aroma with a clear yellow color and medium white head.  Mild carbonation and little flavor.  Somewhat dry finish and thin across the palate.

Spicy ginger and cinnamon nose with a dark brown color and almost no head.  Flavor is similar to the aroma.  Very strong spice and ginger flavor that reminds me of ginger root beer that leaves an over powering aftertaste.  Too much spice and not enough balance for my taste.
